title: USII.1
text: The student will apply history and social science skills to examine westward expansion after the mid-19th century by
strand: Westward Expansion and Its Impact on Indigenous Peoples
subject: United States History 1865 to the Present
course: United States History 1865 to the Present
subs: explaining how technology allowed settlers to adapt to the physical features and climate of the West;
identifying the motivations for westward expansion;
examining the impact of policies, legislation, and treaties associated with the growth of the nation; and
explaining the effect that the growth of the United States had on Indigenous peoples.
